content.text:
# Howard Goodall (painter)

Howard Goodall (1850 – 17 January 1874) was a British painter.
Biography
Goodall was the son of Frederick Goodall, R.A. He showed early promise as a painter. He exhibited at the Royal Academy in 1870, ‘Nydia in the House of Glaucus,’ and in 1873 ‘Capri Girls winnowing.’ On 11 April 1871, in Capri, he accidentally shot and killed his brother Frederick Trevelyan Goodall.
